intro: Bulbostylis latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved bulbostylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often in seasonally flooded areas. Its bulbs, which are underground storage organs, help it survive periods of drought or flooding. Bulbostylis latifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in moist conditions.
